bibl.note: This document is a letter written from Samuel D. Hughes to Adam Fergusson, dated June 4, 1850. Hughes asks Fergusson to send him two pistols that he can use to defend himself against a man by the name of Ross, who had earlier threatened Hughes' life.

div1.p: this is the 4 of June 1850 we ar all well at this time my life is at stake and I wat you to to send or fetch me two of the Best pistoles that you can git in nashvill Ross came in f the fall and thretend to shut be me twist or three times and drew a large hickry stick on me and Swore that he would kill me we are dun planten corn I believe that I shant wright any more at this time only that he drew his pistol or started to But he did not quite cumet do not for git to Bring them if you pleas Sir
